25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Methadone has stopped me from taking oxys I have been on it for 4 yrs and I despratly want off. If only the "Clinics" would tell you about the damage it does to your teeth,waitgain and wors of all when you have surgery methadone has a built in blocker in it.I had major surgery and was dying in pain because the medicine didnt work.Its fab at 1st later on its defanantly a neccessitty.To those who are thinking about getting on it. Remember THE HIGHER YOU TAKE YOU DOSE LOE LONGER YOU'LL BE DEPENDENT ON IT.Another good thing is I no longer do illegal things and have had the same Job for 4+yrs

column2: moonwear, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Most effective over long run for skeletal/muscular/neurological moderate to severe pain. Duration of dose by far outweighs oxycodone, dilaudid, etc. in terms of effectiveness and length of time of relief.

column2: smilineyes27, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking methadone for almost 3 yrs and I have stayed drug free the entire time. I highly recommend doing a MMT program for ppl who have tried detox and rehab and it did not work, but really want to stay drug-free

column2: Driver, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: After years of pain medications I ended up using the top dose of some of the known addictive medications.  After suffering for a few years with addiction, I started to use methadone oral and I feel like a new woman.  My pain is tollerable and I do not want any other pain medication.  If by chance you find youself taking pain medication and not being able to stop, talk with your doctor, that is what I did.  He will help you decide what measures to take to stop taking pain medication.  I chose methadone and I feel free, like I am living a whole new life that is worth living.  Yes there is side effects like sweating, but as far a quality of life, I am living.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had great success with the treatment. I also have cronic pain & this has also helped with the pain & I can live a normal life.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: this drug has literally saved my life in many ways. however, the side effects can be impossible to live with. weight gain, loss of sex drive, inability to have an erection/orgasm are just a few of the details not discussed in the MMT Program.

column2: opiophile12, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Other than the fact I am now dependent on this drug it has been a good experience.    I do not feel it is appropriate for people who use only Vicodin or Percocet.  Methadone is more intense withdrawal than either of those.  If you are addicted to vicodin, I know from experience it is no walk in the park, try suboxone first.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

column2: matt, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Methadone has been a godsend from my oxycontin addiction. Iwas an iv user. Methadone has kept me off it but now i have a new addiction to methadone. It takes longer to come off and now i have a new problem. I was up to 150 mgs a day of methadone and that docter got into trouble. Now i am down to 40 mgs a day and struggle every month to make my prescription last. It has put me into another hell. this does however keep me off the street and from stealing and hurting those around me. I am in a much better place staying out of trouble just with an addiction still. So at least my family and friends can look at me and not worry about their wallets, or be disgusted.

column2: Done.pat.27, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on methadone liquid for about three years. Its been good for the cravings but to get to that point I had to go up on the dosage alot.Overall its helped.

column2: boaboa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this is a wonderful medication and if i would not of gotten on this medication i might not be alive today. i would recomend this treatment to anyone that has a addiction to opioids like vicoden or phentyol or most pain killers. i am on my way back to having my life back and alot of people that i know that are addcted to the phentyol patch are dying from over dose. i dont want to die so i am going to make this work and never again use the patches or any kind of pain killer. i am not going to disfappoint my children ever again.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had fantastic results with treating my addiction to opiats, but it has made me very sick. I want to get off of it but find it very hard. It is an addiction in itsself. It takes a very long time to detox. Overall i would say it works well for my treatment but its not ment for everyone. It made me ill and now i find it hard to get off it.

column2: Ashley, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have alot of pain and this drug just makes me feel worse and icky most of the time!

column2: Pete, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This is the worst drug on the planet.It is more addictive than morphine and takes 3 to 4 times longer to detox off of.No clinic will tell you this cause they want your money.I was told it had no effect on the liver by DRD in Knoxville that is also untrue.If you are addicted to drugs your doctor got you on,report that doctor and seek help from a hospital or private psysician.Do not ever trust a methadone clinic.They all Lie.

column9: my daughter died from it her first time!DEANDRA MAY 10/6/89-7/29/08 I LOVED HER SHE WAS MY LIFE MY LOVE

column2: Rippey, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was once on this medication for chronic pain, but nobody ever told me about all the side effects.  I lost all my teeth from them breaking off while I was eating soft things.  It kept me in a daze all the time (and I was taking it as directed).  I went into rehab to get off of it and I feel better now I still deal with the pain but it is nice to know what is going on around me.
